name: Elves Can be Tanks, Too: Monk 25/CoT 10/Shadowdancer 5
author: Empyre65

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
With both Epic Dodge and Epic Damage Reduction III, this build is hard to kill.

Elves can be Tanks Too (Monk 25 / Champion of Torm 10 / Shadowdancer 5)
Elf, Lawful Non-Evil
Playable 1 - 40, PvM

DEX: 18 (26)
CON: 14 (21)
WIS: 8
INT: 12
CHA: 8

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Frankly, I don't understand this build!
* You take the worst race possible and insist that it too can get Damage reduction. Well, you are right, it can - point proven - so what? You start out 4 ability points behind a dwarf. The elven bonus to dex limits the cost to 2 ability points compared to a similar dwarf dexer build, but you get nothing for throwing away those points.
* The build oozes "love, piece and understanding"! Like you say, it is hard to kill. And you will hardly be able to kill anything worth mentioning with that low AB (35) and damage output.
* To be able to tank, you must pose a threat, or else your opponents will get bored and start attacking your mage and archers instead (given a reasonable pvm AI or pvp). You will probably be the last man (from your party) standing. And then there is nothing more you can do, other than HIPS away and start looking for a nice spot where you can sit down and enjoy the sunset.
I guess there is some RP potential in that, but I'm afraid I still don't understand the build.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: The whole point of the build is to make something unusual: an elf with both Epic Doge AND EDR III. If I wanted to make this a good build, I'd drop EDR, start with 12 CON and 16 STR, turn all CON boosts into DEX boosts, and turn 6 CoT levels into Monk levels. The result would be something that has been done over and over.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:The whole point of the build is to make something unusual: an elf with both Epic Doge AND EDR III. If I wanted to make this a good build, I'd drop EDR, start with 12 CON and 16 STR, turn all CON boosts into DEX boosts, and turn 6 CoT levels into Monk levels. The result would be something that has been done over and over.
You're right, it would be something that has been done over and over, but it would be undeniably better. Still, I understand what you went for

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:The whole point of the build is to make something unusual: an elf with both Epic Doge AND EDR III.
OK, ok - unusual it is
If I wanted to make this a good build, I'd drop EDR, start with 12 CON and 16 STR, turn all CON boosts into DEX boosts, and turn 6 CoT levels into Monk levels. The result would be something that has been done over and over.
For a good reason, I would add.
